   ! Output

END PROGRAM 

FUNCTION getPointsF(n_p, k_p, l_p, r_p, sAll_p, sk_p) RESULT(an)
   IMPLICIT NONE
   INTEGER, INTENT(IN) :: n_p, k_p, l_p, r_p, sAll_p, sk_p
   INTEGER :: sAll, sk, idx !, r UNUSED
   INTEGER, DIMENSION(n_p) :: an

   an = l_p ! Initialize array to l_p (Fortran does this element by element?)

   sAll = sAll_p - sk_p - (n_p -k_p)*l_p 
   sk = sk_p - k_p*l_p 

   ! Handle sk allocation to the last k_p elements
   DO WHILE ( sk >0 )
      idx = n_p
      DO 
         IF ( idx < (n_p -k_p +1 ) ) EXIT IF ( sk <=0 ) EXIT
         an(idx) = an(idx) +1
         sk = sk-1
         idx = idx -1
      END DO
   END DO 

   ! Handle remaining sAll for first n_p-k_p elements
   DO WHILE ( sAll >0 )
      idx = 1
      DO
         IF ( idx > (n_p -k_p) ) EXIT
         IF (sAll <=0 )EXIT
         an(idx) = an(idx) +1
         sAll = sAll -1
         idx = idx +1
      END DO
   END DO 

   RETURN 

END FUNCTION Wait, but in the first line of the function, an = l_p will set all elements of the array an to the integer value l_p.

PROGRAM codeforces_369_B
   IMPLICIT NONE

   INTEGER :: n, k, l, r, sAll, sk
   INTEGER, ALLOCATABLE :: ans(:)
   ! Internal function
   INTERFACE 
      FUNCTION getPointsF(n_p, k_p, l_p, r_p, sAll_p, sk_p) RESULT(an)
         INTEGER, INTENT(IN) :: n_p, k_p, l_p, r_p, sAll_p, sk_p
         INTEGER, DIMENSION(n_p) :: an
      END FUNCTION
   END INTERFACE 

   ! Read input 
   READ(*,*) n, k, l, r, sAll, sk 

   ! Compute
   ans = getPointsF(n, k, l, r, sAll, sk)

   ! Output
   WRITE(*, *) (ans(i), i=1, n)

END PROGRAM 

FUNCTION getPointsF(n_p, k_p, l_p, r_p, sAll_p, sk_p) RESULT(an)
   IMPLICIT NONE
   INTEGER, INTENT(IN) :: n_p, k_p, l_p, r_p, sAll_p, sk_p
   INTEGER :: sAll, sk, idx !, r UNUSED
   INTEGER, DIMENSION(n_p) :: an

   an = l_p ! Initialize array to l_p (Fortran does this element by element?)

   sAll = sAll_p - sk_p - (n_p -k_p)*l_p 
   sk = sk_p - k_p*l_p 

   ! Handle sk allocation to the last k_p elements
   DO WHILE ( sk >0 )
      idx = n_p
      DO 
         IF ( idx < (n_p -k_p +1 ) ) EXIT
         IF ( sk <=0 ) EXIT
         an(idx) = an(idx) +1
         sk = sk-1
         idx = idx -1
      END DO
   END DO 

   ! Handle remaining sAll for first n_p-k_p elements
   DO WHILE ( sAll >0 )
      idx = 1
      DO
         IF ( idx > (n_p -k_p) ) EXIT
         IF (sAll <=0 )EXIT
         an(idx) = an(idx) +1
         sAll = sAll -1
         idx = idx +1
      END DO
   END DO 

   RETURN 

END FUNCTION
